thread.title: Senegal to lodge complaint to CAF, FIFA over Egypt friendly cancellation - National Teams
thread.title_full: Senegal to lodge complaint to CAF, FIFA over Egypt friendly cancellation - National Teams - Sports - Ahram Online

author: english.ahram.org.eg
title: Senegal to lodge complaint to CAF, FIFA over Egypt friendly cancellation - National Teams
text:
Related Egypt to open investigation into Senegal friendly cancellation Egypt cancels Thursday friendly against Senegal Egypt announce squad for friendlies in UAE Egypt announce October friendlies against Zambia, Senegal in UAE Senegal Football Federation (SFF) will lodge a complaint to CAF and FIFA over the sudden cancellation of their friendly game against Egypt, which was scheduled to be played on Thursday in Dubai, a statement read on Friday.
The Egyptian Football Association (EFA) decided to call off the game on Wednesday after discovering that the opponents will not field their senior side.
"The Senegal Football Federation condemn the unacceptable behavior of their Egyptian counterpart, which caused material and moral damages," the SFF statement reported by Senegalese website Wiwsport read.
"We reserve the right to pursue all legal actions indicated in such circumstances, with the competent judicial authorities at CAF and FIFA," the statement added.
Egypt argues that the game was set to be played between A teams of both countries and they were surprised to see the U-23 team show up.
"The SFF was informed of the cancellation a few hours before the game when both sides were already in the United Arab Emirates."
"The SFF wants to stress that they respected all the terms of the agreement signed with the authorised agent by the Egyptian Football Association," the statement added.
The SFF also confirmed that due to "the unavailability of the Senegal A team to play this game for obvious reasons of non-compliance with FIFA provisions, it has explicitly agreed that SFF will field its A team to the game on 8 October in Dubai."
According to a FIFA circular letter number 1355: "There shall also be at least three days between two matches of any national team...It should be noted that if a national team's two matches are not played on the territory of the same confederation, the maximum flight time for the national team between the venues of the two matches shall be five hours over a maximum of two time zones."
Senegal have a scheduled game against Algeria on 13 October in Algiers. The flight between Dubai and Algiers takes more than 6 hours.
Senegal U-23 team are preparing for the Olympic qualifiers where they will play South Africa, Tunisia, and Zambia in Group A while the young Pharaohs have been placed in Group B with Nigeria, Algeria, and Mali.
Egypt youth and sports ministry announced that an investigation would be opened into the cancellation of the game, insisting that those responsible would be punished.
The Pharaohs are scheduled to play their second scheduled friendly during Dubai camp against Zambia on Sunday.
 updates,
